description: Changes the audit policy state of a database activity stream to either locked (default) or unlocked. A locked policy is read-only, whereas an unlocked policy is read/write. If your activity stream is started and locked, you can unlock it, customize your audit policy, and then lock your activity stream. Restarting the activity stream isn't required. For more information, see Modifying a database activity stream in the Amazon RDS User Guide. This operation is supported for RDS for Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for encryption of messages in the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: KinesisStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Kinesis data stream to be used for the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the modification to the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The mode of the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: EngineNativeAuditFieldsIncluded
nested_items.description: Indicates whether engine-native audit fields are included in the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: PolicyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the modification to the policy state of the database activity stream.
